summary: An ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 16775 entitled: "An ordinance relating to and providing for the improvement of East Alder Street from the east line of 29th Avenue to the west line of 30th Avenue, and from the east line of 30th Avenue, to the east line of 31st Avenue; East Terrace Street, from the east line of 30th avenue to the east line of 31st Avenue; 31st Avenue, from Eat Alder Street to East Terrace Street, all in the City of Seattle, by paving the same with asphalt or granite blocks or sandstone blocks if the grade is too steep for asphalt, all in accordance with Majority Petition No. 32417 of the city council of the City of Seattle; and providing payment therefor by the mode of "Payment in Bonds", as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle" approved September 3, 1907.
